builds.name: Defender – Sword & Shield Courage Tank
builds.summary: Frontline Courage-focused build built around sword & shield and a durable Pact (Bromius). Emphasizes blocking, staggering, and protecting allies rather than raw DPS.
tips: Walk forward with guard raised and let minor hits drain stamina instead of health.
Use light strings to build stagger, then heavy attacks or shield bashes to knock enemies down.
Prioritize armor and Stability on gear; you’re the one standing between danger and your allies.

builds.name: Fey Warden – Oscelda Support Healer
builds.summary: Spirit-based Oscelda build focused on healing and crowd control. Ideal for co-op and players who like to stabilize chaotic fights rather than chase top damage.
tips: Lead with Oscelda’s crowd-control Arcanics to lock packs down before they reach your team.
Stay at mid-range with your polearm and reposition between heals rather than face-tanking.
Don’t sit on your healing Arcanics; use them often to smooth out mistakes and chip damage.

builds.name: Omen Howler – Orengall Hybrid DPS
builds.summary: High-tempo Orengall build focused on maintaining howl buffs and shredding enemies with fast Flyblade strings during buff windows.
tips: Keep your howl/buff Arcanics up as often as possible; plan your aggression around those windows.
Weave in and out of melee instead of committing to long trades; you’re quick, not tanky.
This build rewards pattern recognition—learn enemy openings so you can stay on offense safely.

builds.name: Storm Tempest – Ode Lightning Caster
builds.summary: Lightning-focused Ode Tempest build that controls groups of enemies at mid-range with repeated crowd control and AoE bursts.
tips: Use your control Arcanics to keep packs clumped, then detonate them with lightning AoEs.
Stay at mid-range; too far and you waste casts, too close and you risk getting staggered out.
Watch for enemies that resist stagger-style control and be ready to kite instead of face-trading.
